meanings.definition: Having skin darkened or tanned by the sun.
meanings.sent1: Her face looked suntanned after spending the day at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard's suntanned skin showed he spent a lot of time outdoors.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked funny with a suntanned fur coat from lying in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The old book had pages that were as suntanned as an ancient map.
meanings.sent5: The garden gnome had a suntanned complexion from being in the yard all summer.

meanings.definition: To become tanned by exposure to the sun.
meanings.sent1: She suntanned by the pool to get a golden glow for the party.
meanings.sent2: They suntanned on the beach all day and got a bit burnt.
meanings.sent3: The cookies suntanned in the oven a little too long.
meanings.sent4: The grass suntanned under the scorching sun, turning a golden brown.
meanings.sent5: The white shirt suntanned quickly when left out in the sun.
